{
    "number": 287306,
    "data": "29,223,593,1259,8681,11719,14323,16493,16927,18229,19531,20399,21701,23003,26041,28211,29947,31249,32117,34721,36457,39929,41231,42533,42967,44269,45137,46439,293123,316469,324251,350191,355379,363161,381319,396883,402071,425417",
    "name": "Primes that can be generated by the concatenation in base 6, in ascending order, of two consecutive integers read in base 10.",
    "example": [
        "4 and 5 in base 6 are 4 and 5 and concat(4,5) = 45 in base 10 is 29;",
        "6 and 7 in base 6 are 10 and 11 and concat(10,11) = 1011 in base 10 is 223."
    ],
    "maple": [
        "with(numtheory): P:= proc(q,h) local a,b,c,d,k,n; a:=convert(q+1,base,h); b:=convert(q,base,h); c:=[op(a),op(b)]; d:=0; for k from nops(c) by -1 to 1 do d:=h*d+c[k]; od; if isprime(d) then d; fi; end: seq(P(i,6),i=1..1000);"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "With[{b = 6}, Select[Map[FromDigits[Flatten@ IntegerDigits[#, b], b] &, Partition[Range@ 360, 2, 1]], PrimeQ]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 23 2017 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A000040, A030458."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,base,easy",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Paolo P. Lava_, May 23 2017",
    "references": 0,
    "revision": 8,
    "time": "2017-05-24T09:14:00-04:00",
    "created": "2017-05-24T09:14:00-04:00"
}
